sshd.name: OpenSSH Server.....
sshd.description: Standard service for secure remote access (SSH). Provides encrypted communications over insecure networks.
sshd.risk: Medium - Open to brute-force if weak passwords are used.
sshd.recommendation: Use key-based auth, change default port, disable password login.

nginx.name: Nginx Web Server
nginx.description: High-performance HTTP server, reverse proxy, and load balancer.
nginx.risk: Low - Generally secure but misconfiguration can expose data.
nginx.recommendation: Keep updated, use HTTPS, follow hardening guides.

apache2.name: Apache HTTP Server
apache2.description: Widely used web server software. Flexible and modular.
apache2.risk: Low - Secure by default but modularity can increase attack surface.

mysqld.name: MySQL / MariaDB Server
mysqld.risk: Medium - Risk of SQL injection in apps and brute-force if public.
mysqld.recommendation: Never expose to public internet. Bind to localhost.

postgresql.name: PostgreSQL Database
postgresql.risk: Medium - Public ports are targets for brute-force.
postgresql.recommendation: Bind to localhost/VPN. Use strong pg_hba.conf auth.

redis-server.name: Redis In-Memory Data Store
redis-server.description: In-memory key-value store used as database/cache.
redis-server.risk: High - Often exposed without password by default.
redis-server.recommendation: Use strong passwords, bind to specific internal interfaces.

docker.name: Docker Daemon
docker.risk: High - Access to Docker socket/port equals root access.
docker.recommendation: Never expose the Docker API to the network without TLS.

vsftpd.name: Very Secure FTP Daemon
vsftpd.description: FTP server for Linux. FTP is an older, unencrypted protocol.
vsftpd.risk: High - FTP sends passwords in cleartext. Brute-force magnet.
vsftpd.recommendation: Use SFTP (over SSH) instead. If using FTP, use FTPS.

postfix.name: Postfix MTA
postfix.description: Mail Transfer Agent for routing and delivering e-mail.
postfix.risk: Medium - Can be used as an open relay for spam if misconfigured.

dovecot.name: Dovecot IMAP/POP3 Server
dovecot.description: Open-source IMAP and POP3 email server.
dovecot.risk: Medium - Target for e-mail account brute-force.

smbd.name: Samba SMB Server
smbd.description: File and print services for Windows clients.
smbd.risk: High - History of RCE exploits (e.g. EternalBlue).
smbd.recommendation: Keep patched, never expose to public internet.

memcached.name: Memcached Store
memcached.description: In-memory caching system. No authentication by default.
memcached.risk: High - Can be abused for DDoS amplification and data theft.

cupsd.name: CUPS Printing Service
cupsd.description: Common Unix Printing System for managing printers.
cupsd.risk: Low - Can expose info about printers and system.
cupsd.recommendation: Disable if not printing. Restrict to localhost.

bind9.name: BIND DNS Server
bind9.description: Widely used Domain Name System (DNS) software.
bind9.risk: Medium - Subject to DNS amplification and cache poisoning.
bind9.recommendation: Disable open recursion if not needed.

mongod.name: MongoDB Database
mongod.recommendation: Enable authentication, bind to internal IP only.

nfsd.name: NFS Server
nfsd.description: Network File System for sharing directories.
nfsd.recommendation: Only use on trusted internal networks with firewall.

snmpd.name: SNMP Agent
snmpd.description: Used for monitoring system health and performance.
snmpd.risk: Medium - Community strings (passwords) sent in cleartext (v1/v2c).
snmpd.recommendation: Use SNMPv3 with encryption or restrict to specific IPs.

rpcbind.name: RPCbind / Portmapper
rpcbind.description: Maps RPC service numbers to network ports (required for NFS).
rpcbind.recommendation: Restrict via firewall to trusted clients only.

avahi-daemon.name: Avahi mDNS
avahi-daemon.risk: Low - Broadcasts info to local network.
avahi-daemon.recommendation: Disable if local discovery is not needed.

rsyslogd.name: Rsyslog Service
rsyslogd.recommendation: Use TLS for remote logging if active.

dnsmasq.name: Dnsmasq DNS/DHCP
dnsmasq.description: Lightweight DNS forwarder and DHCP server.
dnsmasq.risk: Low - Can be abused if listening on public interfaces.

systemd-resolved.name: systemd Resolved
systemd-resolved.description: Name resolution service for local applications.

beam.name: Erlang VM / RabbitMQ
beam.risk: Medium - Ensure management UI is protected.
beam.recommendation: Use strong passwords for message queues.

python.name: Python Application
python.description: Custom application or script written in Python.
python.risk: Varies - Depends on the application logic.

node.name: Node.js Application
node.risk: Varies - Security depends on app code and dependencies.
